alert.note: Alert for West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 7:26PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Valley County through 815 PM MDT... At 726 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Warm Lake, or 23 miles southeast of McCall, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Poverty Flat Campground around 730 PM MDT. Yellow Pine and Parks Peak around 750 PM MDT. Profile Gap and Elk Summit around 800 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
